results.abstract: Kemp Powers is the co-director of “Soul” and screenwriter of “One Night in Miami,” but his collaborators may not know just how much of himself is in those films.

results.title: Elliot Page, Oscar-Nominated ‘Juno’ Star, Announces He Is Transgender
results.abstract: “Hi friends, I want to share with you that I am trans, my pronouns are he/they and my name is Elliot,” Page wrote in a statement that he posted on Tuesday.

results.abstract: Best known in the United States for his role in the 2001 film “Amélie,” he was a staple of the Comédie-Française theater company and a familiar supporting actor in dozens of movies.

results.title: On TikTok, Fans Are Making Their Own ‘Ratatouille’ Musical
results.abstract: Thousands of TikTok users, including musical theater professionals, are creating a Broadway-style adaptation of the animated Disney film about a rat with culinary aspirations.

multimedia.caption: In “Ratatouille,” the 2007 Disney Pixar film, a rat, Remy, dreams of becoming a chef. With theaters closed during the pandemic, actors and other fans are creating musical tributes to the film on TikTok.

results.title: Some Movies Actually Understand Poverty in America
results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

results.title: HBO Documentary Has Competition. These Women Don’t Seem Worried.
results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.

multimedia.caption: Lisa Heller, left, and Nancy Abraham took over HBO’s documentary department in 2018 amid seismic changes in how documentaries are made, distributed and watched.
